title: 47 Smooth Bible Rizz Pickup Lines & Verses to Chat a Christian Up

steps.title: Rizz up your crush with witty lines inspired by the Bible.
steps.content: Rizz up your crush with witty lines inspired by the Bible. Much like the oceans were teeming with fish when God created the world in Genesis, the Bible is brimming with romantic rizz opportunities. [1] X Research source Almost every famous Bible story and figure can become the basis of an irresistible (or at least entertaining) pickup line that's sure to get a giggle (or an eyeroll) out of whomever you have your eye on. Try these fun, flirty Bible rizz lines out on your beloved, whether they're your crush, your partner, or your spouse. "If we had been on Noah's Ark, you would have been my plus one." "I'm not Jesus and you're not Judas, but can I kiss you anyway?" "Are you Boaz? Because all I want to do is lay by your feet." "I'd split the sea just to ask you on a date." "I'd never worship a golden calf… unless it looked like yours." "If you were a desert, I'd be the Hebrews so I could wander around in you." "There's always room for you in my inn." "Your hair is like a flock of goats leaping down your back. Do you need a shepherd?" "You can water my camels anytime." "You move me like the stone in front of Jesus's tomb." "Pharoah's heart isn't the only thing that's hard right now." "Have you killed any giants lately, because your skin is as smooth as a stone from the brook." "Just call me Lazarus because you bring me back to life whenever I talk to you." "I wish you'd consider my field and buy it." "Give me a kiss, and I'll kiss you for a day. Teach me to kiss, and I'll kiss you for a lifetime." "King Solomon may have had 700 wives and 300 concubines, but all I need is you." "Hey big guy, are you missing a rib? Because I'm pretty sure I've got it." "Not trying to accuse you of sinning or anything, but you did steal my heart." "I read the book of Numbers from front to back last night, but yours wasn't in there. Can I have it?" "I'll walk around you as many times as it takes to make you fall in love with me." "You may not be Biblically accurate, but I still think you're an angel." "I'm no Abraham, but I think you and I could father many nations." "You can cut my hair and betray me to the Philistines any time." "Jesus turned water into wine and made you fine." "Are you the Promised Land? Because I want to be your promised man." "Have you been saved? Because you are truly to die for." "I may not be Joseph, but I had a dream about you and me together last night and I think it's a sign." "Girl, your smile is so bright, I think the Holy Spirit is burning inside you."

steps.title: Send your crush a ready-made rizz line in the form of a Bible verse.
steps.content: Send your crush a ready-made rizz line in the form of a Bible verse. The prophets, kings, and disciples who wrote the books of the Bible never imagined we'd be plumbing the good book's depths for rizz opportunities centuries later. But honestly, what better expresses love and sentiment than scriptures written straight from the heart of God's most beloved servants? Here are rizz-worthy Bible verses you can copy and send directly to the apple of your eye. "This at last is bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh." Genesis 2:23 "I know what a beautiful woman you are." Genesis 12:11 "Don’t go and glean in another field and don’t go away from here." Ruth 2:8 "Come, let us take our fill of love till morning; let us delight ourselves with love." Proverbs 7:18 "'There are three things that amaze me— no, four things that I don’t understand: how an eagle glides through the sky, how a snake slithers on a rock, how a ship navigates the ocean, how a man loves a woman.'" Proverbs 30:18-19 ""Many women have done excellently, but you surpass them all." Proverbs 31:29 "Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor: If either of them falls down, one can help the other up." Ecclesiastes 4:9-10 "Behold, you are beautiful, my love; behold, you are beautiful; your eyes are doves." Song of Solomon 1:15 "As an apple tree among the trees of the forest, so is my beloved among the young men." Song of Solomon 2:3 ""My beloved is mine, and I am his." Song of Solomon 2:16 "I found the one my heart loves." Song of Solomon 3:4 "Your lips are like a scarlet ribbon; your mouth is lovely. Your temples behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate." Song of Solomon 4:3 "You are altogether beautiful, my love; there is no flaw in you." Song of Solomon 4:7 "Place me like a seal over your heart, like a seal on your arm; for love is as strong as death, its jealousy unyielding as the grave." Song of Solomon 8:6 "As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Abide in my love." John 15:9 "Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud." 1 Corinthians 13:4 "And over all these virtues put on love, which binds them all together in perfect unity." Colossians 3:14 "Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins." 1 Peter 4:8 "For this is the message you heard from the beginning: We should love one another." 1 John 3:11 "No one has ever seen God; but if we love one another, God lives in us and his love is made complete in us." 1 John 4:12

steps.title: Find a Bible story, figure, or verse that reminds you of your crush.
steps.content: Find a Bible story, figure, or verse that reminds you of your crush. For example, you may be reminded of your crush's faith in God when reading of Daniel's faithfulness going into the lion's den. [2] X Research source You may also associate them with Queen Esther, a heroine whose courage never failed her and who saved hundreds of thousands of people. [3] X Research source You can also be inspired by a single verse instead of a complete story. For example, you can send your crush the rizz verse, "Don’t go and glean in another field and don’t go away from here" from Ruth 2:8 without knowing the story behind it.

steps.title: Compare yourself or your crush to the Biblical reference.
steps.content: Compare yourself or your crush to the Biblical reference. For example, let's say you're inspired by the story of Deborah and how she led the Israelites into battle against the evil Sisera. Deborah was a judge who sat underneath a tree to counsel her people. You could compare your crush to Deborah and yourself to the tree.

steps.title: Add rizz to your Biblical comparison and craft a cheesy compliment.
steps.content: Add rizz to your Biblical comparison and craft a cheesy compliment. Let's take the previous example where you compared your crush to Deborah. Spinning off that idea, you could say, "Are you Deborah? Because I'd love to sit around and judge other people with you." If you're comparing yourself to the tree, you can amp up your rizz game even more by saying, "I'm the tree to your Deborah."

steps.title: Practice delivering your Bible rizz line before trying it on your crush.
steps.content: Practice delivering your Bible rizz line before trying it on your crush. A rizz line's success, Christian or not, hangs on your posture, facial expression, and the tone of your delivery. Put yourself in front of a mirror or film yourself trying different ways of saying the rizz line and assess how it sounds and looks. Change the way you smile or wiggle your eyebrows, test different hand gestures, and adjust the way your voice goes up and down on each word. Keep testing until you find a delivery you think your crush will enjoy. Try to see yourself saying your Bible rizz line through your crush's eyes. Will they think you're funny and charming or weird and awkward? If you're leaning more toward weird and awkward, work on toning it down. The last thing you want is for your crush to find you off-putting!

steps.title: Read your crush's body language and know when to pull back on the rizz.
steps.content: Read your crush's body language and know when to pull back on the rizz. When you deliver your Bible rizz line, pay attention to how your crush reacts, then pull back or push forward accordingly. For example, if they look uncomfortable, drop the rizz and direct the conversation to a topic you know they enjoy. If they laugh or look amused, though, laugh along with them and see if you can engage them in some witty Christian banter. Then pat yourself on the back for a Bible rizz pickup line well delivered!

steps.title: The Holy Book is ripe with rizz potential waiting to be picked.
steps.content: The Holy Book is ripe with rizz potential waiting to be picked. With that in mind, remember not to use explicit innuendos or disrespect the Word of God or His Son. Most Christian singles choose to date other Christians exclusively because they want a romantic relationship based on values like faith, integrity, and modesty. Flirting is certainly okay in Christianity, but keep your Bible rizz lines and verses PG-rated and well-intentioned. And be prepared to do a complete 180 if your crush isn't amused by your rizz!
